alert.note: Alert for Flathead; Lincoln; Sanders (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 02 at 6:31PM MST until March 02 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Lincoln County in northwestern Montana... North central Sanders County in northwestern Montana... Southwestern Flathead County in northwestern Montana... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 631 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 32 miles west of Kalispell to 28 miles northeast of Thompson Falls, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Highway 2 between mile markers 72 and 96. Locations impacted include... Happys Inn and Bend. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
